alert.note: Alert for Coffee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 11:55PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coffee County through 100 AM CST... At 1154 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rutledge to near Heath. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elba, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, New Brockton, Lee, Kinston, Mixons Crossroads, Curtis, Carl Folsom A/p, Central City, Camp Humming Hills, Clintonville, Roeton, Camp Alaflo Bsa, Arcus, Enterprise Municipal A/P, Alberton, Richburg, Victoria and Danleys Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CST for southeastern Alabama.
